member.summary: Transmit buffer in CAN controller is full

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_OVERRUN
member.summary: CAN controller was read too late

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_BUSLIGHT
member.summary: Bus error: an error counter reached the 'light' limit

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_BUSHEAVY
member.summary: Bus error: an error counter reached the 'heavy' limit

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_BUSWARNING
member.summary: Bus error: an error counter reached the 'warning' limit

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_BUSPASSIVE
member.summary: Bus error: the CAN controller is error passive

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_BUSOFF
member.summary: Bus error: the CAN controller is in bus-off state

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_QOVERRUN
member.summary: Receive queue was read too late

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_REGTEST
member.summary: Test of the CAN controller hardware registers failed (no hardware found)

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_HWINUSE
member.summary: Hardware already in use by a Net

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_NETINUSE
member.summary: A Client is already connected to the Net

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_RESOURCE
member.summary: Resource (FIFO, Client, timeout) cannot be created

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_CAUTION
member.summary: An operation was successfully carried out, however, irregularities were registered

member.summary: Channel is not initialized Value was changed from 0x40000 to 0x4000000

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus.PCAN_ERROR_ILLOPERATION
member.summary: Invalid operation Value was changed from 0x80000 to 0x8000000

member.summary: The PCAN filter is closed. No messages will be received

member.summary: The PCAN-Channel handle is illegal, or its associated hardware is not available

member.summary: The PCAN-Channel handle is available to be connected (Plug and Play Hardware: it means furthermore that the hardware is plugged-in)

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.PCAN_CHANNEL_OCCUPIED
member.summary: The PCAN-Channel handle is valid, and is already being used

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.PCAN_CHANNEL_PCANVIEW
member.summary: The PCAN-Channel handle is already being used by a PCAN-View application, but is available to connect

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.TRACE_FILE_SINGLE
member.summary: A single file is written until it size reaches PAN_TRACE_SIZE

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.TRACE_FILE_SEGMENTED
member.summary: Traced data is distributed in several files with size PAN_TRACE_SIZE

member.summary: Includes the date into the name of the trace file

member.summary: Includes the start time into the name of the trace file

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.TRACE_FILE_OVERWRITE
member.summary: Causes the overwriting of available traces (same name)

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.FEATURE_DELAY_CAPABLE
member.summary: Device supports a delay between sending frames (FPGA based USB devices)

member.name: F:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.FEATURE_IO_CAPABLE
member.summary: Device supports I/O functionality for electronic circuits (USB-Chip devices)

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.Initialize(System.UInt16,Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANBaudrate,Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANType,System.UInt32,System.UInt16)
member.param: The handle of a PCAN Channel
The speed for the communication (BTR0BTR1 code)
NON PLUG AND PLAY: The type of hardware and operation mode
NON PLUG AND PLAY: The I/O address for the parallel port
NON PLUG AND PLAY: Interrupt number of the parallel por

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.Initialize(System.UInt16,Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANBaudrate)
member.param: The handle of a PCAN Channel
The speed for the communication (BTR0BTR1 code)

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.InitializeFD(System.UInt16,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a FD capable PCAN Channel
member.param: The handle of a FD capable PCAN Channel
The speed for the communication (FD bit rate string)
member.remarks: See PCAN_BR_* values Bit rate string must follow the following construction rules: * parameter and values must be separated by '=' * Couples of Parameter/value must be separated by ',' * Following Parameter must be filled out: f_clock, data_brp, data_sjw, data_tseg1, data_tseg2, nom_brp, nom_sjw, nom_tseg1, nom_tseg2. * Following Parameters are optional (not used yet): data_ssp_offset, nom_sam

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.Uninitialize(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Uninitializes one or all PCAN Channels initialized by CAN_Initialize
member.remarks: Giving the TPCANHandle value "PCAN_NONEBUS", uninitialize all initialized channels
member.param: The handle of a PCAN Channel

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.Reset(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Resets the receive and transmit queues of the PCAN Channel
member.remarks: A reset of the CAN controller is not performed
member.param: The handle of a PCAN Channel

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.GetStatus(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Gets the current status of a PCAN Channel
member.param: The handle of a PCAN Channel

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.Read(System.UInt16,Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANMsg@,Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANTimestamp@)
member.summary: Reads a CAN message from the receive queue of a PCAN Channel

A TPCANMsg structure buffer to store the CAN message
A TPCANTimestamp structure buffer to get the reception time of the message

member.summary: Reads a CAN message from the receive queue of a PCAN Channel

A TPCANMsg structure buffer to store the CAN message

member.summary: Reads a CAN message from the receive queue of a FD capable PCAN Channel

A TPCANMsg buffer with the message to be sent

member.summary: Transmits a CAN message over a FD capable PCAN Channel

A TPCANMsgFD buffer with the message to be sent

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.FilterMessages(System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANMode)
member.remarks: The message filter will be expanded with every call to this function. If it is desired to reset the filter, please use the 'SetValue' function
member.param: The handle of a PCAN Channel
The lowest CAN ID to be received
The highest CAN ID to be received
Message type, Standard (11-bit identifier) or Extended (29-bit identifier)

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Basic.PCANBasic.GetErrorText(Peak.Can.Basic.TPCANStatus,System.UInt16,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Returns a descriptive text of a given TPCANStatus error code, in any desired language
member.remarks: The current languages available for translation are: Neutral (0x00), German (0x07), English (0x09), Spanish (0x0A), Italian (0x10) and French (0x0C)
member.param: A TPCANStatus error code
Indicates a 'Primary language ID'
Buffer for the text (must be at least 256 in length)

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.
